description:
The standard ballistic plate issued by the U.S. Army, ESAPI -- Enhanced Small Arms Protective Insert -- is a SAPI-cut ballistic plate with a single-curve profile, composed of a boron carbide strike face a UHMWPE backer.  This plate has been certified ESAPI, which is comparable with the civilian NIJ IV rating.  Plates like this one are intended to be inserted into a plate carrier where it will absorb the energy of multiple rifle rounds before requiring replacement.  On the front, it says <color_yellow>
MEDIUM
STRIKE FACE
HANDLE WITH CARE</color>
On the back, it says <color_yellow>
TOP
7.62 mm APM2 PROTECTION
U.S.</color>, as well as the name of the manufacturer -- Ceradyne, Inc. -- and its serial number.
//weight: Wikipedia lists the weight of a medium-sized ESAPI as 5.5 lbs ≈ 2495 g
IOTV technical manual (TM 10-8470-210-10) lists it as 10.9 lbs per pair, or 5.45 lbs ≈ 2472 g per plate
we choose the Army source as likely to be more accurate

notes: while the thickness of these plates does not appear to be uniform between any two batches, we're going to assume an average of 0.8 in. of thickness

damage_verb: makes a crunch, something has shifted

description: This ceramic plate has been taken out of service by the damage it had suffered.  It will no longer provide significant protection against bullets, and should be replaced or thrown away.

it appears as though both UHMWPE and level IV side plates are significantly more popular

name.str: HighCom UHMWPE tall side plate, NIJ IV
name.str_pl: HighCom UHMWPE tall side plates, NIJ IV

description: A full-cut ballistic plate with slightly clipped corners and a single-curve profile, made of alumina and wrapped in UHMWPE. Manufacturer's logo is proudly displayed on the outward-facing side.  This plate is rated for NIJ IV, which means it's been tested to survive at least 3 rounds of armor-piercing high-energy rifle rounds: some of the most dangerous rounds out there.  Plates like this one are intended to be inserted into a plate carrier where it will absorb the energy of multiple rifle rounds before requiring replacement.  This model is a 6″×8″ side panel and can only fit in side panel pouches on a plate carrier.

name.str: CAG steel medium plate, NIJ III+
name.str_pl: CAG steel medium plates, NIJ III+

description: A SAPI-cut ballistic plate with a single-curve profile, made of AR500 steel by Custom Armor Group.  On the outward-facing side the manufacturer's logo is proudly displayed.  This plate is rated for NIJ III+, which means it's been tested to survive at least 3 rounds of high-energy rifle rounds, and then some.  Plates like this one are intended to be inserted into a plate carrier where it will absorb the energy of multiple rifle rounds before requiring replacement.  This model is sized "medium" and can only fit in carriers that allow medium-sized plates.
